org.phpmaven.plugin.php
Interface IPhpunitConfigurationMojo

All Superinterfaces:
IPhpConfigurationMojo, IPhpWalkConfigurationMojo
All Known Implementing Classes:
PhpTest, PhpUnitCoverage
public interface IPhpunitConfigurationMojo
extends IPhpWalkConfigurationMojo

Interface for mojos that are aware to be configured for phpunit executions. Mainly introduces Getters.

Author:
Martin Eisengardt

Method Summary

          Additional command line arguments for phpunit.

          Set this to "true" to skip running tests, but still compile them.

Methods inherited from interface org.phpmaven.plugin.php.IPhpWalkConfigurationMojo
getExcludes, getIncludes, getPhpFileEnding
 
Methods inherited from interface org.phpmaven.plugin.php.IPhpConfigurationMojo
getAdditionalPhpParameters, getDependenciesTargetDirectory, getLog, getMavenProjectBuilder, getPhpExecutable, getProject, getSession, getTargetClassesDirectory, getTargetTestClassesDirectory, getTemporaryScriptFilename, getTestDependenciesTargetDirectory, isIgnoreIncludeErrors, isLogPhpOutput
 

Method Detail

getTestPostfix

String getTestPostfix()
Which postfix will be used to find test-cases. The default is "Test" and all php files, ending with Test will be treated as test case files. E.g. Logic1Test.php will be used.

Returns:
The php test case postfix.

isSkipTests

boolean isSkipTests()
Set this to "true" to skip running tests, but still compile them. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

Returns:
true to skip the testing

isTestFailureIgnore

boolean isTestFailureIgnore()
Set this to "true" to ignore a failure during testing. Its use is NOT RECOMMENDED, but quite convenient on occasion.

Returns:
true to ignore test failures

isFailIfNoTests

boolean isFailIfNoTests()
Set this to "true" to cause a failure if there are no tests to run. Defaults to "false".

Returns:
true to fail if there are no tests

getPhpUnitArguments

String getPhpUnitArguments()
Additional command line arguments for phpunit. Can be used to parse options (for example the --bootstrap file) but should never be used to set the test file or the xml output script.

Returns:
additional phpunit command line arguments
